page.title: 01Description of the block
page.content: Our project block is a rectangle 4 kms by 3kms. Of this total area less than 1sq km is covered by the village of Edingale which is the only residential area in the block. The rest of the area is undulating, fertile farmland. The fields vary in size between about 90 acres to small paddocks. They are usually bounded by hedges and there are several small copses of deciduous trees. A few of the fields provide grazing for sheep and cattle but the vast majority are under arable crops such as cereals, oil-seed rape and beans. There are a few small fields to the east of the village of Edingale which house shire horses. The shire horses of Edingale are well-known but recently Mr. Holland, who bred them, has retired and sold most of his stock.
